verses.kjv: And I saw another mighty angel come down from heaven, clothed with a cloud: and a rainbow was upon his head, and his face was as it were the sun, and his feet as pillars of fire:
verses.ct: Then I saw another powerful angel descending from heaven, wrapped in a cloud. A rainbow circled his head, his face shone like the sun, and his legs were like columns of fire.

verses.kjv: And he had in his hand a little book open: and he set his right foot upon the sea, and his left foot on the earth,
verses.ct: He held a small scroll that was open in his hand. He planted his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land,

verses.kjv: And cried with a loud voice, as when a lion roareth: and when he had cried, seven thunders uttered their voices.
verses.ct: and he shouted in a thundering voice, like a lion roaring. When he shouted, 7 thunders spoke out with their own voices.

verses.kjv: And when the seven thunders had uttered their voices, I was about to write: and I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Seal up those things which the seven thunders uttered, and write them not.
verses.ct: After the 7 thunders had spoken, I was about to write down what they said. But a voice from heaven told me, "Keep what the 7 thunders said sealed and secret. Don't write it down."

verses.kjv: And the angel which I saw stand upon the sea and upon the earth lifted up his hand to heaven,
verses.ct: Then the angel I had seen standing on the sea and on the land raised his hand toward heaven

verses.kjv: And sware by him that liveth for ever and ever, who created heaven, and the things that therein are, and the earth, and the things that therein are, and the sea, and the things which are therein, that there should be time no longer:
verses.ct: and made an oath by the one who lives forever and ever, who created heaven and everything in it, the earth and everything in it, and the sea and everything in it. He swore that there would be no more delay.

verses.kjv: But in the days of the voice of the seventh angel, when he shall begin to sound, the mystery of God should be finished, as he hath declared to his servants the prophets.
verses.ct: Instead, when the 7th angel is ready to blow his trumpet, God's mystery will be completed, just as he announced to his servants the prophets.

verses.kjv: And the voice which I heard from heaven spake unto me again, and said, Go and take the little book which is open in the hand of the angel which standeth upon the sea and upon the earth.
verses.ct: Then the voice I had heard from heaven spoke to me again and said, "Go take the open scroll from the hand of the angel who is standing on the sea and on the land."

verses.kjv: And I went unto the angel, and said unto him, Give me the little book. And he said unto me, Take it, and eat it up; and it shall make thy belly bitter, but it shall be in thy mouth sweet as honey.
verses.ct: So I approached the angel and asked him to give me the small scroll. He told me, "Take it and eat it. It will turn your stomach bitter, but in your mouth it will taste as sweet as honey."

verses.kjv: And I took the little book out of the angelâ€™s hand, and ate it up; and it was in my mouth sweet as honey: and as soon as I had eaten it, my belly was bitter.
verses.ct: I took the small scroll from the angel's hand and ate it. It tasted as sweet as honey in my mouth, but after I swallowed it, my stomach turned bitter.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, Thou must prophesy again before many peoples, and nations, and tongues, and kings.
verses.ct: Then he told me, "You must prophesy again about many peoples, nations, languages, and kings."
